title: Emma Buckley is a senior lecturer in Latin and Classical Studies at St Andrews University (UK). She has published in the field of early imperial literature and its early modern reception, and is the co-editor of the Blackwell Companion to the Neronian Age (Oxford, 2013) together with Martin Dinter. Her current research focuses on neo-Latin drama and poetry. She is the author of a forthcoming monograph on Valerius Flaccus
and Orientation to the History of Roman Judaea
